positive.review:
[h1]Undertale ‚Äì The Game That Remembered My Soul[/h1]
[b]Rating:[/b] ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ (10/10)

Undertale is one of those rare games that transcends what a ‚Äúgame‚Äù even is. It‚Äôs an experience ‚Äî magical, emotional, and endlessly personal.

From the moment you start, it feels alive. Every action, every choice, every tiny bit of kindness or cruelty ‚Äî the world remembers. And somehow, you end up feeling truly connected to it, as if your heart exists inside its strange, pixelated universe.

The story shifts and bends around your actions, creating something unique for every player. The characters are unforgettable ‚Äî quirky, heartfelt, funny, and painfully human, even when they‚Äôre not human at all. The soundtrack is nothing short of legendary; every track carries emotion, nostalgia, and meaning that stays with you long after the game ends.

Yes, the Genocide route can feel repetitive at times ‚Äî but it‚Äôs meant to. You‚Äôre not supposed to enjoy it; you‚Äôre supposed to feel it. It‚Äôs haunting, heavy, and powerful ‚Äî a bold contrast that gives Undertale its soul.

Everything in this game fits together perfectly: gameplay, story, music, and heart. There‚Äôs nothing missing, nothing wasted. Just pure, thoughtful design and emotion from start to finish.

[hr][/hr]
[h2]Final Thoughts[/h2]
Undertale isn‚Äôt just a 10/10 game ‚Äî it‚Äôs a masterpiece of empathy, storytelling, and creativity. It makes you laugh, it breaks your heart, and then it quietly reminds you what it means to care.
Adventure game with familiar mechanics that is easy to learn, despite the difficulty from bosses to bosses

Undertale is by no means a perfect or phenomenal game. It's simply a game with a singular vision that is executed well. In fact, so much so that its popularity exploded online

What I personally enjoy about Undertale is its reactive and layered design and storytelling. The entire story is woven into the entire game. You can't just watch a cutscene movie online and understand the full picture. This is a [b]GAME[/b], from beginning to end. It shows how you can take narrative in a video game beyond just multiple endings or lore notes scattered across the world. It's in every corner and even the game's code. And most importantly, that story it's telling is heartfelt and genuine

The game wears its love of RPGs on its sleeve, and it loves to play with your expectations. A bit, a character, and a plot point can go far beyond what you initially think. Toby Fox wants you to keep on thinking, to keep on discovering, and to keep on imagining what else could happen. In a way, the game aims to fulfill that endless wonder you had when playing games as a kid. And despite the blatant inspirations and nods to other games, it manages to create an identity so unique that it inspired a generation of fans and creators

All of this, and even more, is what I believe makes Undertale truly special and a game that will stand the test of time

This is my first game that really went to exactly in my heard how many good storys were related with that game heh miss by those days anyway i still remember how that game influenced to myself as a child from those days when i launched this game for first time in my entire life damn it been 10 years a ago still cant believe in that thx for undertale and thx Toby Fox for everything honestly!!!

It looks simple, but every character has so much heart and personality that the world feels alive from the moment you step into it. I love how the game treats morality. Nothing is handed to you, and every choice has weight. It makes you think about what kindness means, even in a pixelated world. A beautiful, clever, emotional masterpiece.

I'm not sure there's anything I can add to the juggernaut that is Undertale.

Music, Gameplay, Story, and frankly everything else is literally genre defining.

My only complaint is that there's new content for releases on other platforms and not included in the Steam version.

The epitome of a masterpiece. Undertale combines heartfelt storytelling, memorable characters, and meaningful choices into one unforgettable experience.

Undertale is an indie role-playing game created by Toby Fox and released in 2015. It‚Äôs known for its quirky humor, memorable characters, and unique approach to combat and storytelling. Some key points:
‚≠ê What makes Undertale special


Choice-driven gameplay: You can fight enemies, talk to them, spare them, or befriend them. Your choices dramatically change the story.


Multiple routes:


Pacifist Route (no one gets hurt)


Neutral Route


Genocide Route (you hunt every enemy)




Meta storytelling: The game ‚Äúremembers‚Äù your actions in unusual ways and often breaks the fourth wall.


Characters: Sans, Papyrus, Toriel, Undyne, Alphys, Asgore, Flowey‚Äîand many more‚Äîare now iconic in gaming culture.


Soundtrack: Composed by Toby Fox; extremely popular for tracks like Megalovania, Hopes and Dreams, and ASGORE.


üéÆ Genre & Style


RPG with bullet-hell style combat mechanics


Retro pixel-art aesthetic inspired by EarthBound


Humor that mixes wholesomeness, absurdity, and emotional storytelling


If you want, I can:


summarize the story (spoiler-free or full spoilers),


explain the different routes,


help with gameplay tips,


discuss characters,


or dive into theories and lore.


What about Undertale are you interested in?

Played on Steam Deck OLED
‚Äî

Performance: Ran flawless with extremely long battery life

Gameplay: This game is a bit different than most but that is where it truly shines. Be prepared to gain fast reflexes and have out of the box thinking on this one. This game also feels like a love letter to some classic games and other pop culture as well.
Undertale is a timeless game that you could play for 11 years straight and still find new things about. There are endless details and every thing you do will matter in the end. Don't forget!

I've played this game... gone a good 20 times, this might not seem like much but for me it is (Though I'm going to play it even more in the future).
I first played Undertale on my parents crappy computer, the Demo in 2013 and I was hooked, as was a lot of the community.
Once the initial version was released... All I can say now from the memory is Love...
Over the years I always come back to this beautiful game, when I'm bored of the world... when I'm tired... when things get sad... or too hard, I always come back.
I rebought the game a while ago for this steam account, and once I started... I couldn't stop, 7 hours of just doing EVERYTHING... all over again... And that True ending? I always cry... and that's why I always come back, it feels genuine... It makes me happy, it makes me laugh (I love puns), it makes me cry...

Sorry for the rant on this old game everyone who sees this... But I will never forget this game, no matter how many years pass...

"Don't kill, don't let yourself be killed"

And when you come back to this game in the future remember,
"Despite everything... it's still you..."
Thank you, Undertale...

Jokes aside, this is a truly wonderful game, nostalgic af, the soundtrack is peak, and i still cant believe this game went under my radar back in 2015. Cant wait to see what my man Toby does with the last 3 chapters of Deltarune.

Undertale is a game that looks simple at first, but it ends up being way deeper than you expect. The gameplay mixes turn-based combat with bullet-hell mechanics, which makes battles feel unique and actually fun instead of repetitive.

One of the best parts of the game is the characters. Everyone you meet has personality, and the dialogue is funny, emotional, and sometimes unexpectedly heartbreaking. The choices you make actually matter, which makes you think how you play instead of attacking everything.

The pixel-art style is simple but charming, and the music is amazing. A lot of the tracks stick with you even after you stop playing, and they really enhance the emotional moments in the story.

If I had to nitpick, some fights can be challenging at first, especially for new players, but it never feels unfair and is super rewarding once you get the hang of it.

Overall, Undertale is a memorable experience that's funny, emotional, and unique. I'd highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys story-driven games with meaningful choices.

*9/10*

Undertale is a game that have derived from the plot devices and gameplay mechanics commonly found on Japanese games, coupled with a storyline that challenge and inspire the mindset of players, creators, and critics alike. 

This game act as mirrors of reflection to the right audience, one that I'm not a part of. But, regardless of whether people can enjoy this game or not, the music found within this game continues to be the setting stones for Internet culture; the astonishing craft of said music have continued to inspire and lead players along the storyline of Deltarune.

Undertale is an absolute gem.

I‚Äôll be honest ‚Äî the gameplay isn‚Äôt usually my style, but the story and characters completely won me over. Every character feels alive and meaningful, and the way your choices affect not only the world but you as the player makes the experience unforgettable. By the time I reached the end, it hit me way harder than I expected.

10/10 ‚Äî A deeply impactful game with unforgettable characters and a beautifully crafted story.

I can say that there are no negatives that I can think of right now. 9.2/10

9/10. Loved the characters, especially Sans and Alphys. The world was so nice and cozy to walk in. I would want to live there if I could, provided no monsters want me dead lol. The music was excellent. Nearly every single track was a straight BANGER! There's a reason why so many memes use this music! And most importantly, the story was one of the most unique stories I've seen in an RPG in a while. "The game where no one needs to die" and it lives up to that phrase! I got neutral route because I thought killing small monsters didn't mean anything. My mistake. I'll try to go for a pacifist run next time. My one criticism is that some of the boss fights attack patterns can be super hard to dodge, leading to frustration. Overall, it's a short and simple RPG that everyone should play!

Undertale has brought light, hope, and wonder into the world from the moment it was created, and in all my years, no other game has ever made me feel‚Äîor cry‚Äîthe way this one has. Its graphics may be simple, but its story and characters are powerful enough to stay with you forever, and I love it so much that I‚Äôve bought it twice on different accounts. It‚Äôs the first game that comes to mind on the bad days, and if I could be left with only one game for the rest of my life, this would be the one without question. Words can‚Äôt truly capture the emotions Undertale evokes, and I often wish I could go back in time just to play it again for the first time and relive that incredible joy I felt when I finished it. I‚Äôm also deeply grateful to Toby Fox for creating Deltarune; while it may not equal Undertale in emotional impact, it is still a game I cherish and hold close with genuine love and care.

i don't recommend this game outside of aesthetics. it's so cute but so slow and frustrating that i've had to put it down out of fear i might break my laptop. i don't play video games often/at all really but this game has a cult following so i thought it would be cool. god i was so wrong.

first off, this is a puzzle game before it's anything else. if you don't like puzzles (i do not like puzzles so they were the worst part) DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME. i got about 4 hours in and found that i had completely forgot what the objectives/goals were because of all the stupid puzzles, and characters, many of which are not important but always introduced like they are, and nonsensical but highly consequential fights. the fights are so fun until they're not. then it just felt like i was getting through the game to finish it.

watch a game play if that's your thing but i don't recommend taking the time to play this yourself unless you really want to play this particular game.

This is a very impactful game, and for this review I am only looking at the game, nothing else, just what the game itself presents. So while I do like the fandom of this game a lot, I don't like the actual game as much.

If there was a neutral option, then I would use that, but because there is not I will have to say negative.
I do enjoy the boss fights, I think they are a fun challenge. It will take a lot of time to beat them, but I do not think it is in an unfair way, the non boss enemies are also quite good, if a bit repetitive. The music is also very good, but that is a known fact at this point.

However it's the story that brings it down, maybe I just don't have the humour but I found most interactions didn't flow very well or weren't that enjoyable. It has a very random = funny humour to it, that I just don't like. It just really did just seem like I had to go through 20 minuets of text just to get an enjoyable fight. Near the end of the game, [spoiler] in genocide specifically, it is just story dumping, you can literally only take about three steps before another textbox appears.[/spoiler]. That is not the only example but it is the most noticeable and I don't personally find that very enjoyable. 

I would give it a 5/10 but the amount of groveling that it takes brings it to a negative over a positive. If you have a different sense of humour then me, then I say go for it, but otherwise I wouldn't recommend it.

"To enjoy this game, you need a high tolerance for tedious time-wasting and endless patience. Otherwise, you'll likely ruin your pacifist run with one accidental click after saving, or perhaps you'll convince yourself it's fine when it's not. Frankly, the game itself is dull, the story is even worse‚Äîand yes, even as a story-focused gamer, I found Undertale's boring. Maybe reading too many good books has made me too critical of it."

Although I obviously know why people love this game, I kinda do too, but there's a weird message that Undertale has in store for gamers that have never played this before. This game teaches you that all forms of violence is wrong. But that's not true. Sometimes we need to defend ourselves, our friends and our families. It's not all cupcakes and rainbows... But that doesn't mean everything in life is terrible. The game is fun, But delivers a message that children would think is good, but in truth will lead to worse and worse judgment. take the Genocide Run for example. What happens if someone accidentally grinds a lot, Thinking it's a normal RPG, and starts a Genocide Run? Will the player think that's the whole game? Or will they just not know what to do next? Nevertheless, Even if they did finish the Genocide Run first, They would probably become a completely different person. The Pacifist Run is alright except when you befriend Alphys and Undyne, They get into a Lesbian Relationship which annoyed me a lot, And worse, It'll teach CHILDREN ABOUT IT. So do I like this game? Well... Yes... and No. The main game is ok along with the flaws I told you about. But I also like the alternate universes that fans of Undertale have created in their community. I used to play Undertale-Themed games on Roblox all the time. But that still doesn't mean that you should buy this. I played, I finished all runs, I had joy, I had disappointment. If you're a child that knows better about stuff like this, Then buy it all you want, But please know that this game delivers a strange message about violence and has gay characters. That's all I have to say.

It's not a badly made game but cannot understand why people have hyped it up so much. Gave it a try because I heard so much good about it. Has it's moments storywise but overall not a fun game.
Thought I could push myself to finish it since it's supposed to be short but I will call it quits after a few attempts at the Asgore fight.
Boring. Best part about this game is its fanart. I don't think any game has actually managed to make me fall asleep before.
I don't like it. The story is bland and the gameplay is repetitive.

better off playing any game from the 90's tbh. nothing special
Gameplay is nothing out of the ordinary, just turn based fighting without any quirks that make it interesting.
Story is whatever, nothing special there either, has you wasting alot of your time on side missions that don't lead to anywhere.
Graphics are intentionally very poor in attempt to make the game look old, but with this there just isn't a lot to look at when playing, not much that catches your eye as anything. only characters and buildings; the bare minimum.
game has occasionally good compositions, though it's not the best
In addition to this, if you're playing on a 60% keyboard like a huge portion of gamers do, then this game is a waste of money, as it is not compatible with it, you would have to rebind your keyboard in a special way to play it which can take quite a while on some devices.
And don't get me started with the fanbase...

Boring as hell, controls are rage-inducing, gameplay is atrocious, feels tedious and frustrating overall.
Even if you look at the story alone it's a 5/10 at best.
The best thing are the little conversations (which still drag on too long sometimes) and the music.
Also the community being the way it is speaks volumes itself. (though i just think they're mainly kids)

This game is utter trash.  The only reason it's popular is because it's popular.  You know, the herd is following something trendy.  Basically the same reason people watch football when it is a bunch of sweaty burly dudes in tights wrestling over balls and yelling go deep to tight ends.  This game is almost as gay.

The difference?  Terrible graphics.  Even worse game play.  Even worse than that is the dialogue.  Any game that has "Tee hee!" in it saps testosterone and should be burned.  It is a game for tweens that think they're edgy.  If you're a furry, this game is right up your ally.  I am a giga chad, so, I see this game for what it is, infantile garbage.

There is literally nothing redeeming about this game.  I am serious, anyone being honest will have to concede that people only pretend to like it.  Watch any review and you will hear all this praise over the game, but never why.  You hear ambiguous nonsense rather than anything substantive as to why it's good or why anyone over 12 should play it.

My dudes, if you don't shut this off the second you run into the skeleton brothers and that off the charts cringe, then you are probably gay because that skeleton certainly is.  100% Hello Kitty is more masculine than this game.

Not even once.

This game is an open wound inflicted on gaming, and is probably the worst game to ever hit mainstream.

It is only popular because it is popular, and everyone is branded a troll if they point out what a poorly thought out excuse for a game it is.

EXP does not stand for experience points, it stands for execution points. That's the smartest thing this developer could come up with.

I don't really see what everyone else loves about this game. Its incredibly unpolished and very repetitive. I get that its made by only one dude, but Stardew Valley and Hollow Knight both show that very small teams can still make incredibly good games with lots of polish. Feels like the creator didn't really care about making a good game and just wanted to make something to say he did and it accidently blew up.

it just a copy of Final Fantasy and idk just too plain loooking for me so SORRY BUT i have to say not recommended also the music hurts my ears A LOT!!!!!!! fix Ur music and maybe i will change my mind but for now yeah Srry just not fun to play with the really loud music

Oh boy oh biddy oh Bayleaf this game did NOT age well XD
What this game offers you is a decent narrative experience that falls off in the best ending and sacrifices gameplay in the worst ending. It's decently put together, but I think it survived as long as it has mostly on music. The music is great, don't get me wrong, but if you've ever played a Sonic game before, you know that's not always enough.
Now that Deltarune is out and being developed, there's really no reason to come back to this game except for bragging rights of defeating that one super hard boss. It's worth your money if you have an open mind about the story and don't try to read between the lines too hard, $10 is incredibly cheap, but I gotta be honest Mr. Tobias "Please Stop Calling Me Radiation" Fox, you coulda had this in the oven a bit longer.
Also all my homies hate Toriel.
I don't want to play a game using arrow keys. I won't use 3rd party software to rebind my keys to use wasd. Game is mid at best.
man dis shit low key overated. man the music good but it gets annoying. Also the game gets very boring and repetive when your trying to get the good ending.
the game itself was mid, im only leaving this rating because its honestly really overrated. seriously most of the game is just walking and then randomly having to fight a monster
Absolutely boring and slog to finish.  Went in blind from all the praise and wish I could forget the time wasted trying to enjoy it.
really boring. the gameplay just sucks. how do you make fighting enemies boring? how? well whoever made this game managed to make it boring. how this game even became popular i have no idea
Graphics were lazy. I really like 8-bit, but this was just lazy 8-bit. The story was the worst part.

[h1] UNDERTALE - Disappointing and Short? [/h1]
Rating: ‚òÖ (1/5)
Hello I am writing a negative review of this video game out of overwhelming CONFUSION and FRUSTRATION...

According to my Daughter, UNDERTALE is considered one of the most Iconic video games of All time? (She told me that even the late Pope Francis was GIFTED A COPY!!) Out of sheer Curiosity, I decided to check out the Trailer for UNDERTALE on Steam and thought it was a very Interesting fast-paced Game! Starting the Game out and playing for roughly half an Hour, the game forces you to Confront the Friendly monster named Toriel (The Fight was a little Difficult but I managed to beat it after a few attempts). After hearing from my Daughter that there are Multiple Endings to this Video Game, including Sparing ALL Monsters, I decided to try and Spare Toriel because I thought she was a very Nice Monster. But for some reason, the Game suddenly ENDS?! 
I Asked my Daughter if I did something Wrong and she Told me I was not meant to Spare Toriel... 
I tried replaying the Game to see if Anything was supposed to Change by killing Toriel, but the Game still ENDED the SAME WAY!!
You mean to TELL ME that "One of the most ICONIC Video Games of ALL TIME" is just a DEMO?!
This Game is DEFINITELY NOT WORTH MY WALLET!!!
ITS NOT LETTING ME PLAY WASD INSTEAD OF ARROW KEYS AND I HAD TO CHANGE MY WHOLE PCS SETTINGS TO MAKE IT MY MAIN MONITOR
